headline.main: U.S. AGENT ACCUSED AT NAZI SPY TRIAL; Defendant Says He Was Urged to Aid German Cause

lead_paragraph: Carl Reuper, a defendant in the Brooklyn espionage trial, testified yesterday that he had rejected the suggestion of a counter-espionage agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation that he report details of the United States defense program to Germany in revenge for "what England did to Germany after the World War."
abstract: C Reuper denies W Nipkin testimony; says he refused Air Assocs Inc blueprints offered by latter
